definition: the will of Heaven/the will of God
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: Do you see people who are spiritually unable to find their way back home?
sentences.chinese: 你是否看见灵命失丧的人无法归家？

sentences.english: Pastor, where are the Our Daily Bread devotionals?
sentences.chinese: 牧师，灵修手册《灵命日粮》在哪里？

sentences.english: I have felt the burden laid upon me to have a watch-care for your soul.
sentences.chinese: 我感到身负重任，对守护看顾你的灵命有负担。
灵命的停滞会锈蚀心灵。

sentences.english: Hidden manna speaks of secret nourishment for our spiritual lives.
sentences.chinese: 隐藏的吗哪是喻意基督会帮助我们的灵命成长。

sentences.english: Only participation in the full life of a local church builds spiritual muscle.
sentences.chinese: 只有积极参加当地教会生活，灵命才会增长。

sentences.english: To get better with age, get spiritually fit.
sentences.chinese: 要想越老越好，就追求灵命更高。

sentences.english: I asked God to make my spirit grow. God said, No.
sentences.chinese: 我求神使我的灵命长进，神说不。

sentences.english: Spiritual growth is sometimes tedious work, one small step at a time.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，灵命成长是冗长沉闷的工作，一次一小步。

definition: (third person pronoun for a divine being)
to maintain/to adhere to/to observe (an injunction etc)
